|STARTSENT| You need to know what happens to a system when the load increases. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Load testing seeks to answer the following |NUMBER|. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| What is the maximum load that my current system can support? |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Which represents the bottleneck in the current system that limits the performance? |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| This parameter is referred to as the resource ceiling. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Depending upon a configuration, any resource can have a bottleneck removed, and the resource ceiling then passes onto another resource. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Can I alter the configuration of my server in order to increase capacity? |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| How does this performance relate to your other servers that might have different characteristics? |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Note Load testing is also referred to as performance testing, reliability testing, stress testing, and volume testing. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| n If you have one production system running in the cloud, then overloading that system until it breaks going to make you popular with your colleagues. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| However, cloud computing offers virtual solutions. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| One possibility is to create a clone of your single system and then use a tool to feed that clone a recorded set of transactions that represent your application workload. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Two examples of applications that can replay requests to Web servers are HTTPerf |URL| and Siege (|URL| but both of these tools run the requests from a single client, which can be a resource limitation of its own. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| You can run Autobench (|URL| to run HTTPerf from multiple clients against your Web server, which is a better test. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| You may want to consider these load generation tools as IBM Rational Performance Tester (|URL| Load testing software is a large product category with software and hardware products. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| You will find load testing useful in testing the performance of not only Web servers, but also application servers, database servers, network throughput, load balancing servers, and applications that rely on client-side processing. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Part Using Platforms When you have multiple virtual servers that are part of a server farm and have a load balancer in front of them, you can use your load balancer to test your resource ceilings. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| This technique has the dual advantages of allowing you to slowly increment traffic on a server and to use real requests while doing so. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Most load balancers allow you to weight the requests going to a specific server with the goal of serving more requests to more powerful systems and fewer requests to less powerful systems. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Sometimes the load balancer does this optimization automatically, and other times you can exert manual control over the weighting. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Whatever method you use to load a server for performance testing, you must pick a method that is truly representative of real events, requests, and operations. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| The best approach is to incrementally alter the load on a server with the current workload. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| When you make assumptions such as using a load balancer to serve traffic based on a condition that summarizes the traffic pattern instead of using the traffic itself, you can get yourself into trouble. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Problems with load balancers have led to some spectacular system failures because those devices occupy a central controlling site in any infrastructure. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| For example, if you assume that traffic can be routed based on the number of connections in use per server and your traffic places a highly variable load based on individual requests, then your loading measurements can lead to dramatic failures when you attempt to alter your infrastructure to accommodate additional loads. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Resource ceilings Whatever performance measurement tool you use, the goal is to create a set of resource utilization curves similar to the ones shown in Figure |URL| for individual server types in your infrastructure. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| To do this, you must examine the server at different load levels and measure utilization rates. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| The graphs in Figure |URL| indicate that over a certain load for a particular server, the CPU (A), RAM (B), and Disk (C) utilization rates rise but do not reach their resource ceiling. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| In this instance, the Network (D) reaches its maximum utilization at about |NUMBER| percent of the tested load, and this factor is the current system resource ceiling. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Network is often a bottleneck in Web servers, and this is why, architecturally, Web sites prefer to scale out using many low-powered servers instead of scaling up with fewer but more powerful servers. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| You saw this play out in the previous chapter where cloud was described. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Adding more (multi-homing) or faster network connections can be another solution to improving Web performance. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Unless you alter the performance of the server profiled in Figure |URL| to improve it, you are looking at a maximum value for that workload of WSmax, as shown in the dashed line at the load point in graph D. At this point, the server is overloaded and the system begins to fail. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Some amount of failure may be tolerable in the short term, provided that the system can recover and not too many Web hits are lost, but this is a situation that you really want to minimize. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| You can consider WSn to be the red line, the point at which the system should be generating alerts or initiating scripts to increase capacity. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Chapter |NUMBER|: Capacity Planning FIGURE |URL| Resource utilization curves for a particular server CPU Load Disk Load RAM Load Network WSmax WSmax Smax WSnSn WSn Load Notice that I have not discussed whether these are physical or virtual servers. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| The parameter you are most interested in is likely to be the overall system capacity, which is the value of WT. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| WT is the sum over all the Web servers in your WT Σ(WSnP WSnV) In this equation, WSnP represents the workload of your physical and WSnV is the workload of the virtual servers (cloud-based server instances) of your infrastructure. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| The amount of overhead you allow yourself should be dictated by the amount of time you require to react to the challenge and to your tolerance for risk. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| A capacity planner would define a value WT such that there is sufficient overhead remaining in the system to react to demand that is defined by a number greater than WMAX by bringing more resources on-line. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| For storage resources that tend to change slowly, a Part Using Platforms planner might set the red line level to be |NUMBER| percent of consumption of storage; for a Web server, that utilization percentage may be different. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| This setting would give you a safety factor. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| There are more factors that you might want to take into account when considering an analysis of where to draw the red line. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| When you load test a system, you are applying a certain amount of overhead to the system from the load testing feature that is often called the “observer effect.” Many load testers work by installing lightweight agents on the systems to be tested. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Those agents themselves impact the performance you see; generally though, their impact is limited to a few percent. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Additionally, in order to measure performance, you may be forced to turn on various performance counters. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| A performance counter is also an agent of sorts; the counter is running a routine that measures some aspect of performance such as queue length, file rate, numbers of READs and WRITEs, and so forth. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| While these complications are second order effects, always good to keep this in mind and not over-interpret performance results. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Before leaving the topic of resource ceilings, consider a slightly more complicated case that you might encounter in MySQL database systems. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Database servers are known to exhibit resource ceilings for either their file caches or their Disk performance. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| To build high-performance applications, many developers replicate their master MySQL database and create a number of slave MySQL databases. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| All READ operations are performed on the slave MySQL databases, and all WRITE operations are performed on the master MySQL database. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Figure |URL| shows this sort of database architecture. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| A database system has two competing processes and the same server that are sharing a common READs and WRITEs to the databases, and replication traffic between the master database and all the slave databases. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| The ratio of these transactions determines the WSn for the system, and the WSn you derive is highly dependent upon the system architecture. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| These types of servers reach failure when the amount of WRITE traffic in the form of INSERT, UPDATE, and DELETE operations to the master database overtakes the ability of the system to replicate data to the slave databases that are servicing SELECT operations. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| The more slave databases there are, the more actively the master database is being modified and the lower the WS for the master database is. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| This system may support no more than |NUMBER|-|NUMBER| percent transactional workload as part of its overall capacity, depending upon the nature of the database application you are running. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| You increase the working capacity of a database server that has a Disk resource ceiling by using more powerful disk arrays and improving the interconnection or network connection used to connect the server to its disks. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Disk is particularly sensitive to the number of spindles in use, so having more disks equals greater performance. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Keep in mind that your ability to alter the performance of disk assets in a virtual or cloud-based database server is generally limited. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Tip A MySQL replication architectural scheme is used for smaller database applications. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| As sites grow and the number of transactions increases, developers tend to deploy databases in a federated architecture. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| The description of cloud in Chapter |NUMBER| describes this approach to large databases, creating what are called sharded databases. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| n FIGURE |URL| Resource contention in a database server Writes WritesWrites (SQL INSERTS, (SQL inserts, (SQL inserts, UPDATES, and updates, and updates, and DELETES) deletes) deletes) Chapter |NUMBER|: Capacity Planning Master database Slave database Transactions Transactions Transactions Replication Replication Replication Database server READS Reads Reads (SQL SELECTS) (SQL selects) (SQL selects) Slave database Slave database So far seen two cases. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| In the first case, a single server has a single application with a single resource ceiling. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| In the second case, you have a single server that has a single application with two competing processes that establish a resource ceiling. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| What do you do in a situation where your server runs the full LAMP stack and you have two or more applications running processes each of which has its own resource ceiling? |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| In this instance, you must isolate each application and process and evaluate their characteristics separately while trying to hold the other resource usage at a constant level. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| You can do this by examining identical servers running the application individually or by creating a performance console that evaluates multiple factors all at the same time. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Remember, real-world data and performance is always preferred over simulations. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| As your infrastructure grows, it becomes more valuable to create a performance console that lets you evaluate your KPIs (Key Performance Indicators) graphically at an instant. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Many third-party tools offer performance consoles, and some tools allow you to capture their state so you can restore it at a later point. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| An example of a performance analysis tool that lets you save its state is the Microsoft Management Console (MMC). |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| In the Amazon Web Service, the statistics monitoring tool is called Amazon CloudWatch, and you can create a performance monitoring console from the statistics it collects. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Part Using Platforms Server and instance types One goal of capacity planning is to make growth and shrinkage of capacity predictable. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| You can greatly improve your chances by standardizing on a few hardware types and then well characterizing those platforms. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| In a cloud infrastructure such as Amazon Web Server, the use of different machine instance sizes is an attempt to create standard servers. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Reducing the variability between servers makes it easier to troubleshoot problems and simpler to deploy and configure new systems. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| As much as possible, you also should assign servers standardized roles and populate those servers with identical services. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| A server with the same set of software, system configuration, and hardware should perform similarly if given the same role in an infrastructure. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| At least the theory. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| In practice, cloud computing quite as mature as many physical servers, and in practice, there is more performance variability in cloud machine instances than you might expect. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| This variability may be due to your machine instances or storage buckets being moved from one system to another system. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Therefore, you should be attentive to the increase in potential for virtual system variability and build additional safety factors into your infrastructure. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| System instances in a cloud can fail, and it is up to the client to recognize these failures and react accordingly. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Virtual machines in a cloud are something of a black box, and you should treat them as such because you have no idea what the underlying physical reality of the resources you are using represents. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Capacity planning seeks to compare the capability of one system against another system and to choose the solution that is not only the right size but provides the service with the best operational parameters at the lowest cost. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| In Figure |URL| a graph of different server types is shown, with some hypothetical physical servers plotted against Amazon Machine Instance types. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| This type of graph allows you to add the appropriate server type to your infrastructure while performing a cost analysis of the deployment. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| An Amazon Machine Instance (AMI) is described as Micro |NUMBER| MB memory, |NUMBER| to |NUMBER| Compute Units (|NUMBER| virtual core, using |NUMBER| CUs for short periodic bursts) with either a or platform Small Instance |URL| memory, |NUMBER| Compute Unit (|NUMBER| virtual core with |NUMBER| Compute Unit), instance storage plus root partition), platform, Performance: Moderate, and API |URL| High-Memory Quadruple Extra Large |URL| of memory, |NUMBER| Compute Units (|NUMBER| virtual cores with |URL| Compute Units each), of instance storage, platform, Performance: High, and API |URL| High-CPU Extra Large |NUMBER|GB of memory, |NUMBER| Compute Units (|NUMBER| virtual cores with |URL| Compute Units each), of instance storage, platform, Performance: High, API |URL| View this at |URL| I expand on this in Chapter |NUMBER|. |ENDSENT|

|STARTSENT| Amazon says that an Compute Unit is the equivalent of a |URL| GHz |NUMBER| Opteron or |NUMBER| Xeon processor, but adds that “Over time, we may add or substitute measures that go into the definition of an Compute Unit, if we find metrics that will give you a clearer picture of compute capacity.” What they are saying essentially is that this was the standard processor their fleet used as its baseline, and that over time more powerful systems may be swapped in. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Whatever the reality of this situation, from the standpoint of capacity planning, all you should care about is measuring the current performance of systems and right-sizing your provisioning to suit your needs. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| In cloud computing, you can often increase capacity on demand quickly and efficiently. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Not all cloud computing infrastructures automatically manage your capacity for you as Amazon Web Auto Scaling (|URL| feature does. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| At this point in the maturity of the industry, some systems provide automated capacity adjustments, but most do not. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Part Using Platforms Nor are you guaranteed to be provided with the needed resources from a cloud vendor at times you might need it most. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| For example, Amazon Web infrastructure runs not only machine instances, but also |URL|’s machine instances as well as |URL|’s instances. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| If you need more virtual servers on Black Monday to service Web sales, you may be out of luck unless you have an SLA that guarantees you the additional capacity. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Finding an SLA that you can rely on is still something of a crap shoot. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| If you are in the position of having to maintain the integrity of your data for legal reasons, this imposes additional problems and constraints. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Cloud computing is enticing. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| It is easy to get started and requires little up-front costs. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| However, cloud computing is not cheap. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| As your needs scale, so do your costs, and you have to pay particular attention to costs as you go forward. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| At the point where you have a large cloud-based infrastructure, you may find that it is more expensive to have a metered per-use cost than to own your own systems. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| The efficiencies of cloud computing, as I describe more fully in Chapter |NUMBER| necessarily in the infrastructure itself. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Most of the long-term efficiencies are realized in the reduced need for IT staff and management, the ability to react quickly to business opportunities, and the freeing of a business from managing networked computer systems to concentrate on their core businesses. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| So while the Total Cost of Ownership (TCO) of a cloud-based infrastructure might be beneficial, it might be difficult to convince the people paying the bills that this is really so. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Network Capacity If any cloud-computing system resource is difficult to plan for, it is network capacity. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| There are three aspects to assessing network Network traffic to and from the network interface at the server, be it a physical or virtual interface or server Network traffic from the cloud to the network interface Network traffic from the cloud through your ISP to your local network interface (your computer) This makes analysis complicated. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| You can measure factor |NUMBER| the network at the interface with system utilities, as you would any other server resource. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| For a cloud-based virtual computer, the network interface may be a highly variable resource as the cloud vendor moves virtual systems around on physical systems or reconfigures its network pathways on the fly to accommodate demand. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| But at least it is measurable in real time. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| To measure network traffic at a network interface, you need to employ what is commonly known as a network monitor, which is a form of packet analyzer. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Microsoft includes a utility called the Microsoft Network Monitor as part of its server utilities, and there are many third-party products in this area. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| The site |URL| has a list of packet sniffers at |URL| |URL| Here are Wireshark (|URL| formerly called Ethereal Chapter |NUMBER|: Capacity Planning Regardless of which of these tools you use, the statistics function of these tools provides a measurement of network capacity as expressed by throughput. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| You can analyze the data in a number of ways, including specific applications used, network protocols, traffic by system or users, and so forth all the way down to, in some cases, the content of the individual packets crossing the wire. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Note Alternative names for packet analyzer include network analyzer, network traffic monitor, protocol analyzer, packet sniffer, and Ethernet sniffer, and for wireless networks, wireless or wifi sniffer, network detector, and so on. |ENDSENT|

|STARTSENT| Internet connectivity over the last mile (to the home) is the Achilles heel of cloud computing. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| The scarcity of high-speed broadband connections (particularly in the United States) and high pricing are major impediments to the growth of cloud computing. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Many organizations and communities will wait on the sidelines before embracing cloud computing until faster broadband becomes available. |ENDSENT|

|STARTSENT| Scaling In capacity planning, after you have made the decision that you need more resources, you are faced with the fundamental choice of scaling your systems. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| You can either scale vertically (scale up) or scale horizontally (scale out), and each method is broadly suitable for different types of applications. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| To scale vertically, you add resources to a system to make it more powerful. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| For example, during scaling up, you might replace a node in a cloud-based system that has a dual-processor machine instance equivalence with a quad-processor machine instance equivalence. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| You also can scale up when you add more memory, more network throughput, and other resources to a single node. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Scaling out indefinitely eventually leads you to an architecture with a single powerful supercomputer. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Vertical scaling allows you to use a virtual system to run more virtual machines (operating system instance), run more daemons on the same machine instance, or take advantage of more RAM (memory) and faster compute times. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Applications that benefit from being scaled up vertically include those applications that are processor-limited such as rendering or memory-limited such as certain database against an in-memory index, for example. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Horizontal scaling or scale out adds capacity to a system by adding more individual nodes. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| In a system where you have a dual-processor machine instance, you would scale out by adding more dual-processor machines instances or some other type of commodity system. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Scaling out indefinitely leads you to an architecture with a large number of servers (a server farm), which is the model that many cloud and grid computer networks use. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Horizontal scaling allows you to run distributed applications more efficiently and is effective in using hardware more efficiently because it is both easier to pool resources and to partition them. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Although your intuition might lead you to believe otherwise, the most powerful computers are currently built using clusters of computers aggregated using high speed interconnect technologies such as InfiniBand or Myrinet. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Scale out is most effective when you have an resource ceiling and you can eliminate the communications bottleneck by adding more channels. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Web server connections are a classic example of this situation. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Part Using Platforms These broad generalizations between scale up and scale out are useful from a conceptual standpoint, but the reality is that there are always tradeoffs between choosing one method for scaling your cloud computing system versus the other. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Often, the choice so clear-cut. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| The pricing model that cloud computing vendors now offer their clients fully mature at the moment, and you may find yourself paying much more for a high-memory extra-large machine instance than you might pay for the equivalent amount of processing power purchased with smaller system equivalents. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| This has always been true when you purchase physical servers, and it is still true (but to a much smaller extent) when purchasing virtual servers. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Cost is one factor to pay particular attention to, but there are other tradeoffs as well. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Scale out increases the number of systems you must manage, increases the amount of communication between systems that is going on, and introduces additional latency to your system. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Summary In this chapter, you learned about how to match capacity to demand. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| To do this, you must measure performance of your systems, predict demand, and understand demand patterns. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| You must them allocate resources to meet demands. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| When demand is higher, you must provision additional resources, and when demand is lower, you must tear down resources currently in place. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Cloud use of virtual resources offers exciting new ways to flexibly respond to demand challenges. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Cloud computing also poses some new risks and makes additional demands on the capacity planner that this chapter discusses. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| The key to capacity planning is through measurement of current system performance and the collection of a meaningful historical data set. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| This chapter described some of the tools you need to perform these analyses, a general approach you must take, and how to act based on the results you find. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| In Chapter |NUMBER| I more fully explore the Platform as a Service (PaaS) model that provides a new application delivery paradigm. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| PaaS is the delivery of a complete computer platform as well as an application stack. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| You can use systems of these types to create solutions that you use or offer to others as a service. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Because the infrastructure and architecture is already in place, PaaS allows you to concentrate on a very specific service that leverages the investment already made by the PaaS vendor. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Chapter |NUMBER| describes some of these types of services, the application frameworks used in PaaS, and some of the programming tools in place. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| IN THIS CHAPTER Understanding the PaaS service model Learning about PaaS development Viewing examples of PaaS sites and tools Discovering common PaaSbuilt application features Exploring Platform as a Service The Platform as a Service model provides the tools within an environment needed to create applications that can run in a Software as a Service model. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| For this reason, some overlap between vendors has created Software as a Service products, and those vendors have broadened their services to make their Web applications more customizable. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Salesforce. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| com, the largest CRM application service company in the world, is an example, with |URL| being its PaaS (Platform as a Service) offering. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Applications developed in PaaS systems can be composite business applications, data portals, or mashups with data derived from multiple sources. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| PaaS environments can offer integrated lifecycle management or anchored lifecycle applications. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| An integrated system provides a broad range of tools for customization, whereas an anchored system is based on already established software. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Application frameworks are a particularly powerful tool for creating cloud computing applications. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| For this reason, many vendor products are based on this model. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| In other chapters, you learn about Google AppEngine and Windows Azure Platform. |ENDSENT|

|STARTSENT| Part Using Platforms Defining Services In many ways, the Platform as a Service model is the most interesting of all the hosted services in cloud computing. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| IaaS offers a service that is akin to installing an application on a computer. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| That computer is virtual, of course, but it is still a computer. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| By the time you are using an SaaS model, the software is pretty well mapped out for you. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| You can do some modest customization, some branding perhaps, but the capabilities and design has largely been worked out. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| With Platform as a Service systems, you are given a toolkit to work with, a virtual machine to run your software on, and it is up to you to design the software and its user-facing interface in a way that is appropriate to your needs. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| So PaaS systems range from full-blown developer platforms like Windows Azure Platform to systems like Drupal, Squarespace, Wolf, and others where the tools are modules that are very well developed and require almost no coding. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Many Content Management Systems (CMS) are essentially PaaS services where you get standard parts and can build Web sites and other software like Tinker Toys. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Thus you find that PaaS models span a broad range of services, including these, among Application A PaaS platform either provides the means to use programs you create in a supported language or offers a visual development environment that writes the code for you. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Collaboration: Many PaaS systems are set up to allow multiple individuals to work on the same projects. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Data Tools are provided for accessing and using data in a data store. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Instrumentation, performance, and Tools are available for measuring your applications and optimizing their performance. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Storage: Data can be stored in either the PaaS service or accessed from a thirdparty storage service. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Transaction Many PaaS systems provide services such as transaction managers or brokerage service for maintaining transaction integrity. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| PaaS systems exist to allow you to create software that can be hosted as SaaS systems or to allow for the modification of existing SaaS applications. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| seen many examples of PaaS systems already, and whole chapters are dedicated to vendor-specific PaaS platforms. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| The next chapter describes the Google AppEngine, which is a system for deploying Web applications on Google infrastructure. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Chapter |NUMBER| describes the Windows Azure Platform with its emphasis on creating Windows applications using the Framework on Microsoft infrastructure. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| A good PaaS system has certain desirable characteristics that are important in developing robust, scalable, and hopefully portable applications. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| On this list would be the following Separate of data management from the user interface Reliance on cloud computing standards Chapter |NUMBER|: Exploring Platform as a Service An integrated development environment (IDE) Lifecycle management tools Multi-tenant architecture support, security, and scalability Performance monitoring, testing, and optimization tools The more vibrant the associated market of a third-party add-ons, applications, tools, and services, the better they are. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| These extras allow you to extend your application by buying functionality, which is almost always cheaper than having to roll your own. |ENDSENT|

|STARTSENT| Application development A PaaS provides the tools needed to construct different types of applications that can work together in the same environment. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| These are among the common application Composite business applications Data portals Mashups of multiple data sources A mashup is a Web page that displays data from two or more data sources. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| The various landmarks and overlays you find in Google Earth, or annotated maps, are examples of mashups. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| These applications must be able to share data and to run in a multi-tenant environment. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| To make applications work together more easily, a common development language such as Java or Python is usually offered. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| The more commonly used the language is, the more developers and developer services are going to be available to help users of platform applications. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| The use of application frameworks such as Ruby on Rails is useful in making application building easier and more powerful. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Part Using Platforms Most of the application building tools in this chapter create their own frameworks. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Many are based on visual tools, and often these tools allow developers to extend applications using a common language for Web application development. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| These applications almost always adopt a Service Oriented Architecture model and use with XML data exchange. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| All PaaS application development must take into account lifecycle management. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| As an application ages, it must be upgraded, migrated, grown, and eventually phased out or ported. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Many PaaS vendors offer systems that are integrated lifecycle development platforms. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| That is, the vendor provides a full software development stack for the programmer to use, and it expected that the developer will need to go outside of the service to create his application. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| An integrated lifecycle platform includes the The virtual machine and operating system (often offered by an IaaS) Data design and storage A development environment with defined Application Programming Interfaces Middleware Testing and optimization tools Additional tools and services Google AppEngine, Microsoft Windows Azure Platform, Eccentex AppBase, LongJump, and Wolf are examples of integrated lifecycle platforms. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| The latter three services are described in this chapter. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Refer to Chapter |NUMBER| to read about AppEngine, and see Chapter |NUMBER| to learn about Azure. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Some PaaS services allow developers to modify existing software. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| These services are referred to as anchored lifecycle platforms. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Examples of an anchored lifecycle platform are |URL| and |URL| The applications in these two services are fixed, but developers can customize which applications the users see, how those applications are branded, and a number of features associated with the different applications. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| An anchored service offers less customization, but has a faster development cycle and may be less prone to software errors. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Using PaaS Application Frameworks Application frameworks provide a means for creating SaaS hosted applications using a unified development environment or an integrated development environment (IDE). |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| PaaS IDEs run the gamut from a tool that requires a dedicated programming staff to create and run to graphical interfaces that any knowledgeable computer user can navigate and create something useful with. |ENDSENT|

|STARTSENT| They offer tools for establishing business objects or entities and the relationships between them. |ENDSENT|

|STARTSENT| For the most part, they provide tools where snippets of code provide exception programming. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| These services are extensible and customizable through application code. |ENDSENT|

|STARTSENT| Part Using Platforms Exploring Google Applications Few companies have had as much impact on their industries as Google has had on the computer industry and on the Internet in particular. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Some companies may have more Internet users (Microsoft comes to mind) or have a stock valuation higher than Google (Apple currently fits that description), but Google remains both a technology and thought leader for all things Internet. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| For a company whose motto is be evil,” the impact of consumer tracking and targeted advertising, free sourcing applications, and the relentless assault on one knowledge domain after another has had a profound impact on the lives of many people. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| I call it the Google Effect. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| The bulk of income comes from the sales of target advertising based on information that Google gathers from your activities associated with your Google account or through cookies placed on your system using its AdWords system. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| In |NUMBER| revenue was billion, and it controlled roughly |NUMBER| percent of the search market through its various sites and services. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| The company is highly profitable, and that has allowed Google to create a huge infrastructure as well as launch many free cloud-based applications and services that this chapter details. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| These applications are offered mostly on a free usage model that represents Software as a Service portfolio. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| A business model that offers cloud-based services for free that are “good enough” is very compelling. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| While Google is slowly growing a subscription business selling these applications to enterprises, its revenue represents only a small but growing part of current income. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| cloud computing services falls under two umbrellas. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| The first and best-known offerings are an extensive set of very popular applications that Google offers to the general public. |ENDSENT|

|STARTSENT| In |DATE|, Google introduced a development platform for hosted Web applications using infrastructure called the Google App Engine (GAE). |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| The goal of GAE is to allow developers to create and deploy Web applications without worrying about managing the infrastructure necessary to have their applications run. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| GAE applications may be written using many high-level programming languages (most prominently Java and Python) and the Google App Engine Framework, which lowers the amount of development effort required to get an application up and running. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Goggle also allows a certain free level of service so that the application must exceed a certain level of processor load, storage usage, and network bandwidth before charges are assessed. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Chapter |NUMBER|: Using Google Web Services FIGURE |URL| More Google Products equals fewer commercial products. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Google App Engine applications must be written to comply with infrastructure. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| This narrows the range of application types that can be run on GAE; it also makes it very hard to port applications to GAE. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| After an application is deployed on GAE, it is also difficult to port that application to another platform. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Even with all these limitations, the Google App Engine provides developers a low-cost option on which to create an application that can run on a world-class cloud all the attendant benefits that this type of deployment can bestow. |ENDSENT|

|STARTSENT| Indexed search search technology is based on automated page indexing and information retrieval by Web crawlers, also called spiders or robots. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Content on pages is scanned up to a certain number of words and placed into an index. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Google also caches copies of certain Web pages and stores copies of documents it finds such as DOC or PDF files in its cache. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Google uses a patented algorithm to determine the importance of a particular page based on the number of quality links to that page from other sites, along with other factors such as the use of keywords, how long the site has been available, and traffic to the site or page. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| That factor is called the PageRank, and the algorithm used to determine PageRank is a trade secret. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Google is always tweaking the algorithm to prevent Search Engine Optimization (SEO) strategies from gaming the system. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Based on this algorithm, Google returns what is called a Search Engine Results Page (SERP) for a query that is parsed for its keywords. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| It is really important to understand what Google (and other search engines) offers and what it offer. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Google does not search all sites. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| If a site register with the search engine or Chapter |NUMBER|: Using Google Web Services the target of a prominent link at another site, that site may remain undiscovered. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Any site can place directions in their |URL| file indicating whether the site can be searched or not, and if so what pages can be searched. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Google developed something called the Sitemaps protocol, which lets a Web site list in an XML file information about how the Google robot can work with the site. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Sitemaps can be useful in allowing content that browsable to be crawled; they also can be useful as guides to finding media information that normally considered, such as AJAX, Flash, or Silverlight media. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| The Sitemaps protocol has been widely adopted in the industry. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Note While dynamic content presented in AJAX normally indexed, Google now has a procedure that helps the Google engine crawl this information. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| You can read about it |URL| The dark Web Online content that indexed by search engines belongs to what has come to be called the “Deep is, content on the World Wide Web that is hidden. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Any site that suppresses Web crawlers from indexing it is part of the Deep Web. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| You need go no further than the number two Web site, Facebook, for a prominent example of a site that indexed in search engines. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Entire networks exist that searchable, particularly networks. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Ian Freenet, which is a network, supports both “darknet” and “opennet” connections. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Freenet (|URL| has been downloaded by millions of people. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| The Deep Web Database generated Web pages or dynamic content Pages without links Private or limited access Web pages and sites Information contained in sources available through executable code such as JavaScript Documents and files that in a form that can be searched, which includes not only media files, but information in non-standard file formats Although efforts are underway to enable information on the Deep Web to be searchable, the amount of information stored that is not accessible is many times larger than the amount of information that can currently be accessed. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Some estimates at the size of the Dark Web suggest that it could be an order of magnitude larger than the content contained in the search engines. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| It is always a good idea to keep these search engine limitations in mind when you work with this technology. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Part Using Platforms Aggregation and disintermediation Aggregation pages are a great user service, but they are very are a number of search applications and services. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| It has long been argued that display of information from various sites violates copyright laws and damages content providers. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| In several lawsuits, Google successfully defended its right to display capsule information under the Digital Millennium Copyright Act, while in other instances Google responds to requests from interested parties to remove information from its site. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| The Authors filed a class action suit in |NUMBER| regarding unauthorized scanning and copying of books for the creation of the Google Books feature. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Google reached a negotiated agreement with the Authors Guild that specified obligations under the fair use exemption. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Google argues that the publicity associated with searchable content adds value to that content, and it is clear that this is an argument that will continue into the future. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| What is clear is that Google has been a major factor in a trend referred to as disintermediation. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Disintermediation is the removal of intermediaries such as a distributor, agent, broker, or some similar functionary from a supply chain. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| This connects producers directly with consumers, which in many cases is a very good thing. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| However, disintermediation also has the unfortunate side effect of impacting organizations such as news collection agencies (newspapers, for example), publishers, many different types of retail outlets, and many other businesses, some of which played a positive role in the transactions they were involved in. |ENDSENT|

|STARTSENT| AdWords AdWords (|URL| is a targeted ad service based on matching advertisers and their keywords to users and their search profiles. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| This service transformed Google from a competent search engine into an industry giant and is responsible for the majority of revenue stream. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| two largest competitors are Microsoft adcenter |URL| and Yahoo! |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Search Marketing |URL| Ads are displayed as text, banners, or media and can be tailored based on geographical location, frequency, IP addresses, and other factors. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| AdWords ads can appear not only on |URL| but on AOL search, |URL| and Netscape, along with other partners. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Other partners belonging to the Google Display Network can also display AdSense ads. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| In all these cases, the AdWords system determines which ads to match to the user searches. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| how the system Advertisers bid on keywords that are used to match a user to their product or service. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| If a user searches for a term such as “develop abdominal muscles,” Google returns products based on those terms. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| You might see an ad with Chuck Norris selling a modernday version of a torture rack that, if it give you a six-pack, at least makes your wallet lighter. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Up to |NUMBER| ads per search can be returned. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Google gets paid for the ad whenever a user clicks it. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| The system is referred to as advertising, and the success of the ad is measured by what is called the click-through rate (CTR). |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Google calculates a quality score for ads based on the CTR, the strength of the connection between the ad and the keywords, and the history with Google. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| This quality score is a Google trade secret and is used to price the minimum bid of a keyword. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Part Using Platforms In |NUMBER| Google purchased DoubleClick, an Internet advertising services company. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| DoubleClick helps clients create ads, provides hosting services, and tracks results for analysis. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| DoubleClick ads leave browser cookies on systems that collect information from users that determine the number of times a user has been exposed to a particular ad, as well as various system characteristics. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Some spyware trackers flag DoubleClick cookies as spyware. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Both AdWords and DoubleClick are sold as packages to large clients. |ENDSENT|

|STARTSENT| Chapter |NUMBER|: Using Google Web Services Analytics works by using a JavaScript snippet called the Google Analytics Tracking Code (GATC) on individual pages to implement a page tag. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| When the page loads, the JavaScript runs and creates a first-party browser cookie that can be used to manage return visitors, perform tracking, test browser characteristics, and request tracking code that identifies the location of the visitor. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| GATC requests and stores information from the account. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| The code stored on the system acts like a beacon and collects visitor data that it sends back to GA servers for processing. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Among the visitors that can be tracked are those that land from search engines; referral links in e-mail, documents, and Web pages; display ads; PPC networks; and some other sources. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| GA aggregates the data and presents the information in a visual form. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| GA also is connected to the AdWords system so it can track the performance of particular ads in different contexts. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| You can view referral location statistics and time spent on a page, and you can filter by visitor site. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| GA lets you save and store up to |NUMBER| individual site profiles, provided the site has less than |NUMBER| million pageviews per month. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| This restriction is lifted for an AdWords subscription. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| GA cookies are blocked by a number of technologies, such as Firefox Adblock and NoScript or by turning off JavaScript execution in other browsers. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| You also can delete GA cookies manually or block them, which also defeats the system. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Google Translate Of all the Google applications, the one that might have significant immediate impact is Google Translate. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Computer technology is very close to having the necessary hardware and software to realize the dream of a “universal translator” that the TV show Star Trek proposed some |NUMBER| years ago. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| The current version of Google Translate performs machine translation as a cloud service between two of your choice of |NUMBER| different languages. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| not truly universal, but until aliens appear, it will do for most people. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Google Translate was introduced in |NUMBER| and replaced the SYSTRAN system that many other computer services utilize. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| The translation method uses a statistical approach that was first developed by Franz-Joseph Och in |NUMBER|. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Och now heads the Translate effort at Google. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Translate uses what is referred to as a corpus linguistics approach to translation. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| You start off building a translation system for a language pair by collecting a database of words and then matching that database to two bilingual text corpuses. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| A text corpus or parallel collection is a database of wordand phrase-usage taken from the language in everyday use obtained by examining documents translated by professionals to software analysis. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Among the documents that are analyzed are the translations of the United Nations and European Parliament, among others. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Google Translate can be accessed directly at |URL| where you can select the language pair to be translated. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| You can do the Enter text directly into the text box, and click the Translate button to have the text translated. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| If you select the Detect Language option, Translate tries to determine the language automatically and translate it into English. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Enter a URL for a Web page to have Google display a copy of the translated Web page. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Part Using Platforms Enter a phonetic equivalent for script languages. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Upload a document to the page to have it translated. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Translate parses the document into words and phrases and applies its statistical algorithm to make the translation. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| As the service ages, the translations are getting more accurate, and the engine is being added to browsers such as Google Chrome and through extension into Mozilla Firefox. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| The Google Toolbar offers page translation as one of its options, selectable in the Tools settings. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| The Google Translator Toolkit (|URL| shown in Figure |URL| provides a means for using the Translate to perform translations that you can edit. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Shown in the figure is the translation of an article from the English version of Wikipedia into Spanish. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| The toolkit provides access to tools to aid you in editing the translation. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Translation services have been in development for many years. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| IBM has had a large effort in this area, and the Microsoft Bing search engine also has a translation engine. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| There are many other translation engines, and some of them are even cloud-based like Google Translate. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| What makes efforts potentially unique is the work in language is, the conversion of voice to text. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| As part of Google Voice and its work with Android-based cell phones, Google is sampling and converting millions and millions of conversations. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Combining these two Web services together could create a translation device based on a cloud service that would have great utility. |ENDSENT|

|STARTSENT| Working with the Google App Engine Google App Engine (GAE) is a Platform as a Service (PaaS) cloud-based Web hosting service on infrastructure. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Figure |URL| shows the GAE home page at |URL| This service allows developers to build and deploy Web applications and have Google manage all the infrastructure needs, such as monitoring, failover, clustering, Part Using Platforms machine instance management, and so forth. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| For an application to run on GAE, it must comply with platform standards, which narrows the range of applications that can be run and severely limits those portability. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| GAE supports the following major Dynamic Web services based on common standards Automatic scaling and load balancing Authentication using Accounts API Persistent storage, with query access sorting and transaction management features Task queues and task scheduling A client-side development environment for simulating GAE on your local system One of either two runtime Java or Python When you deploy an application on GAE, the application can be accessed using your own domain name or using the Google Apps for Business URL. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| FIGURE |URL| The Google App Engine page at |URL| Chapter |NUMBER|: Using Google Web Services Google App Engine currently supports applications written in Java and in Python, although there are plans to extend support to more languages in the future. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| The service is meant to be languageagnostic. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| A number of Java Virtual Machine languages are compliant with GAE, as are several Python Web frameworks that support the Web Server Gateway Interface (WSGI) and CGI. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Google has its own Webapp framework designed for use with GAE. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| The AppScale |URL| open-source framework also may be used for running applications on GAE. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| To encourage developers to write applications using GAE, Google allows for free application development and deployment up to a certain level of resource consumption. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Resource limits are described on quota page at |URL| |URL| and the quota changes from time to time. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Google uses the following pricing CPU time measured in CPU hours is per hour. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Stored data measured in GB per month is per Incoming bandwidth measured in GB is per GB. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Outgoing bandwidth measured in GB is per GB. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Recipients e-mailed is per recipient. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| The pricing page for Google AppEngine may be found |URL| The current resource limits are shown in Table |URL| Consumption of resources beyond the free limit is generally on a basis, although in certain circumstances, Google may allow for additional free usage. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| When you enable billing for an application deployed to GAE, you pay for consumption of CPU, network and other usage above the level of the free quotas that GAE allows. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| TABLE |URL| Apps Quota Limits Resource Quotas Free Default Quota Billing Enabled Default Quota Applications per developer Application size Bandwidth limit (in and out) CPU usage Datastore API calls Data received from API |NUMBER| up to queup to No fixed limit No fixed limit free and max, up to rate |URL| free to CPUmaximum, up to |NUMBER| CPUmaximum rate |NUMBER| million up to |NUMBER| up to Part Using Platforms TABLE |URL| Resource Quotas Free Default Quota Billing Enabled Default Quota Data sent to API Data storage Datastore CPU Time E-mails HTTP requests Indexes Storage per application Storage API calls Storage item limit Time per request allowed URLFetch API calls up to |NUMBER| CPU-hours, up to |NUMBER| min up to No free quota up to calls/min up to free, no maximum CPU-hours, up to |NUMBER| min free to |URL| million recipients max, up to recipients/min requests, up to rate free, no limit |NUMBER| million up to |NUMBER| GB free, no maximum |NUMBER| million up to |URL| Applications running in GAE are isolated from the underlying operating system, which Google describes as running in a sandbox. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| This allows GAE to optimize the system so Web requests can be matched to the current traffic load. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| It also allows applications to be more secure because applications can connect only to computers using the specified URLs for the e-mail and fetch services using HTTP or HTTPS over the standard well-known ports. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| URL fetch uses the same infrastructure that retrieves Web pages on Google. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| The mail service also supports messaging system. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Applications also are limited in that they can only read files; they cannot write to the file system directly. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| To access data, an application must use data stored in the memcache (memory cache), the datastore, or some other persistent service. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Memcache is a fast in-memory key-value cache that can be used between application instances. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| For persistent data storage of transactional data, the datastore is used. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Additionally, an application responds only to a specific HTTP real-time, part of a queue, or any request is terminated if the response requires more than |NUMBER| seconds to complete. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| GAE has a distributed datastore system that supports queries and transactions. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| This datastore is non-relational or “schema-less,” but it does store data objects or entities that are assigned properties. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| In your queries, you can use entities filtered by kind or type and also sorted by properties. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| You can find a list of the various property types at |URL| the list includes strings, Chapter |NUMBER|: Using Google Web Services booleans, float, datetime, blob, text, and other property types. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Each application can structure its own sets of data entities. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| The datastore uses an optimistic concurrency control and maintains strong consistency. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| An application can execute transactions with multiple operations, and they either all succeed or fail as a unit. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| To support the distributed nature of the datastore, the concept of an entity group is employed. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Transactions manage entities as a single group, and entity groups are stored together in the system so operations can be performed faster. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| The App Engine relies on the Google Accounts API for user authentication, the same system used when you log into a Google account. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| This provides access to e-mail and display names within your app, and it eliminates the need for an application to develop its own authentication system. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Applications can use the User API to determine whether a user belongs to a specific group and even whether that person is an administrator for your application. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Many applications have been built and are running on Google App Engine. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| To get some idea of the range of applications that have been developed, you may want to visit the Google App Engine Gallery. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| This gallery is found at |URL| and is shown in Figure |URL| It is searchable by keyword and category. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| FIGURE |URL| Google App Engine gallery page may be found at |URL| Part Using Platforms Summary In this chapter, you learned about all things Google. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| The range of applications and services that Google offers is truly impressive; the company is essentially a self-contained ecosystem. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| empire is built on its highly regarded search engine. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| The company monetized search technology by attaching target advertising to searches that its users perform. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| This revenue has allowed Google to create a range of applications and services on the Web that are having real impact in society. |ENDSENT|

|STARTSENT| That is why you find services on so many of the Web sites. |ENDSENT|

|STARTSENT| Development and deployment of these applications are free, as is some basic usage of the application. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| You can scale your applications on a basis to whatever size you need. |ENDSENT|

|STARTSENT| IN THIS CHAPTER Learning about Amazon Web Services Instantiating Amazon Machine Images Provisioning storage, databases, and other services Learning about other AWS offerings Realizing the potential of Infrastructure as a Service Using Amazon Web Services |URL| is one of the most important and heavily trafficked Web sites in the world. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| It provides a vast selection of products using an infrastructure based on Web services. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| As |URL| has grown, it has dramatically grown its infrastructure to accommodate peak traffic times. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Over time the company has made its network resources available to partners and affiliates, which also has improved its range of products. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Starting in |NUMBER| |URL| made its Web service platform available to developers on a usage-basis model. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| The technologies described in this chapter represent perhaps the best example of Web services achieved through the Service Oriented Architecture of components that you learn about in Chapter |NUMBER|. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Through hardware virtualization on Xen hypervisors, Amazon. |ENDSENT|

|STARTSENT| Chapter |NUMBER|: Using Amazon Web Services Working with the Elastic Compute Cloud Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud is a virtual server platform that allows users to create and run virtual machines on server farm. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| With you can launch and run server instances called Amazon Machine Images (AMIs) running different operating systems such as Red Hat Linux and Windows on servers that have different performance profiles. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| You can add or subtract virtual servers elastically as needed; cluster, replicate, and load balance servers; and locate your different servers in different data centers or “zones” throughout the world to provide fault tolerance. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| The term elastic refers to the ability to size your capacity quickly as needed. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| The difference between an instance and a machine image is that an instance is the emulation of a hardware platform such as IA|NUMBER| and so on running on the Xen hypervisor. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| A machine image is the software and operating system running on top of the instance. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| A machine image may be thought of as the contents of a boot drive, something that you could package up with a program such as Ghost, Acronis, or TrueImage to create a single file containing the exact contents of a volume. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| A machine image should be composed of a hardened operating system with as few features and capabilities as possible and locked down as much as possible. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Consider a situation where you want to create an Internet platform that provides the A high transaction level for a Web application A system that optimizes performance between servers in your system Data driver information services Network security The ability to grow your service on demand Implementing that type of service might require a rack of components that included the An application server with access to a large RAM allocation A load balancer, usually in the form of a hardware appliance such as BIG-IP A database server Firewalls and network switches Additional rack capacity at the ISP A physical implementation of these components might cost you something in the neighborhood of depending upon the scale of your application. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| With AWS, you might be able to have an equivalent service for as little as and have a high level of availability and reliability to boot. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| This difference may surprise you, but it is understandable when you consider that AWS can run its services with a much greater efficiency than your company would alone and therefore amortize its investment in hardware over several customers. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| That is the promise and the potential of cloud computing realized and why large Web sites such as |URL| have moved to AWS. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Part Using Platforms Amazon Machine Images AMIs are operating systems running on the Xen virtualization hypervisor. |ENDSENT|

|STARTSENT| Pricing models The pricing of these different AMI types depends on the operating system used, which data center the AMI is located in (you can select its location), and the amount of time that the AMI runs. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Rates are quoted based on an hourly rate. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Additional charges are applied the amount of data transferred whether Elastic IP Addresses are assigned your virtual private use of Amazon Elastic Block Storage (EBS) whether you use Elastic Load Balancing for two or more servers other features AMIs that have been saved and shut down incur a small one-time fee, but do not incur additional hourly fees. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| The three different pricing models for AMIs are as On-Demand This is the hourly rate with no long-term commitment. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Reserved This is a purchase of a contract for each instance you use with a significantly lower hourly usage charge after you have paid for the reservation. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Spot This is a method for bidding on unused capacity based on the current spot price. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| This feature offers a significantly lower price, but it varies over time or may not be available when there is no excess capacity. |ENDSENT|

|STARTSENT| Working with Amazon Storage Systems When you create an Amazon Machine Instance you provision it with a certain amount of storage. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| That storage is temporal, it only exists for as long as your instance is running. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| All of the data contained in that storage is lost when the instance is suspended or terminated, as the storage is reassigned to the pool for other AWS users to use. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| For this and other reasons you need to have access to persistent storage. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| The Amazon Simple Storage System provides block storage, but is set up in a way that is somewhat unique from other storage systems you may have worked with in the past. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Amazon Simple Storage System Amazon cloud-based storage system allows you to store data objects ranging in size from |NUMBER| byte up to in a flat namespace. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| In storage containers are referred to as buckets, and buckets serve the function of a directory, although there is no object hierarchy to a bucket, and you save objects and not files to it. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| It is important that you do not associate the concept of a filesystem with because files are not supported; only objects are stored. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Additionally, you do not “mount” a bucket as you do a filesystem. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| The system allows you to assign a name to a bucket, but that name must be unique in the namespace across all AWS customers. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Access to an bucket is through the Web API (either with SOAP or REST) and is slow relative to a real-world disk storage system. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| performance limits its use to non-operational functions such as data archiving and retrieval or disk backup. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| The REST API is preferred to the SOAP API, because it is easier to work with large binary objects with REST. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| You can do the following with buckets through the Create, edit, or delete existing buckets Upload new objects to a bucket and download them Search for and find objects and buckets Find metadata associate with objects and buckets Specify where a bucket should be stored Make buckets and objects available for public access One tool commonly used to manage data for Amazon is the command line client The service is used by many people as the third level backup component in a |NUMBER|-|NUMBER|-|NUMBER| backup strategy. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| That is, you have your original data (|NUMBER|), a copy of your data (|NUMBER|), and an off-site copy of Chapter |NUMBER|: Using Amazon Web Services your data (|NUMBER|); the latter of these may be In this regard, acts as a direct competitor to backup system. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| One of the options available to you is versioning for Amazon With versioning, every version of an object stored in an bucket is retained, provided you enable the versioning feature. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Any HTTP or REST operation such as PUT, POST, COPY, or DELETE creates a new object that is stored along with the older version. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| A GET operation retrieves the newest version of the object, but the ability to recover and undo actions is available. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Versioning also can be used for preserving data and for archiving purposes. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Amazon provides large quantities of reliable storage that is highly protected but to which you have low bandwidth access. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| excels in applications where storage is archival in nature. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| For example, you find in use by large photo sharing sites. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| In the next section see Elastic Block Storage or EBS. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| In EBS you create virtual drives that you can use with your machine instances in the same way that you would use a hard drive with a physical system. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| EBS tends to be used in transactional systems where high-speed data access is required. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Caution Keep in mind that while Amazon is highly reliable, it is not highly available. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| You can definitely get your data back from at some point with guaranteed fidelity, but the service is not always connected and experiences service outages. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| By comparison, an EBS volume is offered with an annual failure rate of |URL|% to |URL|%, about a factor of |NUMBER| better than typical disk drives you use in your own physical servers. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| n Amazon Elastic Block Store (EBS) The third of data storage systems are devoted to Amazon Elastic Block Storage (EBS), which is a persistent storage service with a high operational performance. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Advantages of EBS are that it can store file system information and its performance is higher and much more reliable than Amazon That makes EBS valuable as an operational data storage medium for AWS. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| The cost of creating an EBS volume is also greater than creating a similarly sized bucket. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| An EBS volume can be used as an instance boot partition. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| The advantages of an EBS boot partition are that you can have a volume up to retain your boot partition separately from your instance, and use a boot partition volume as a means for bundling an AMI into a single package. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| EBS boot partitions can be stopped and started, and they offer fast AMI boot times. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| EBS is similar in concept to a Storage Area Network or SAN; you create block storage volumes varying in size from to and make those volumes available to your machine instances. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| The performance of a volume is dependent upon the network and therefore varies as a function of the size of your instance (see Table |URL| as well as the type of disk operations (random, sequential, request size, and READS or WRITE) that are in progress. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| When you create volumes, they appear first as raw block storage devices that must be formatted for use. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| A volume is mounted on a particular instance and is available to that instance alone; that is, volumes may not be shared between instances. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Volumes may be located in the same zone as the AMI to which they are attached. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Volumes appear as if they are devices (physical drives) when attached to an instance. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| You can mount multiple volumes on a single instance, if desired, and create striped RAID volumes for faster performance. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| The filesystem for mounted volumes appears when you open the volume, and you can install applications or copy data to mounted volumes as you would any physical disk. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Part Using Platforms EBS supports volume replication within the same availability zone, which can add an extra level of fault tolerance to the data set. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| The use of replication means that mirroring a volume add much additional fault tolerance. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Snapshots are the recommended approach to improving your volreliability. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| You can make an instance image or snapshot of your AMI, and these snapshots are then copied out to Amazon You can use these snapshots as system images to create new AMIs or to restore a volume (and instance) to that snapshot when needed. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| You can share snapshots with other authorized users by using a context menu in the AWS Management Console and selecting the Snapshot Permissions command. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| When you create a new volume from an snapshot, the data is slowly copied to the new volume. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| As you start working on the new volume, any missing data is downloaded preferentially as needed. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Each snapshot you take adds incremental changes to the previous snapshot, which means that while the first snapshot takes a fair amount of time, subsequent snapshots are usually executed quickly and with only a modest amount of extra storage space required. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Tip EBS supports a special feature of AWS called a Public Data Set, which is a data repository that is made available at no extra charge to AWS customers; only the data transfer and compute fees are paid for working with the data set. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Examples of Public Data Sets in use are the Annotated Human Genome map, |URL| Census Databases (|NUMBER| |NUMBER| and |NUMBER|), UniGene transcript sequences, and |URL| data dump, among others. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| To learn more about Public Data Sets, see |URL| n EBS is a service priced on the amount of storage space used, how long you use it, and the number of requests made to the volume. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| You can use a utility like IOSTAT to measure of your systems to estimate these transaction costs, which vary greatly by operating system and application. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Amazon quotes an example of a medium-sized database of with |NUMBER| per sec costing about per month for the allocated storage and per month for the (there are |URL| million seconds in a month). |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Snapshots are priced on the storage blocks used, not on the size of the volume being stored. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| Amazon also charges for the amount of data transferred to Amazon during a snapshot. |ENDSENT|

|STARTSENT| In edge computing, content is pushed out geographically so the data is more readily available to network clients and has a lower latency when requested. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| You enable CloudFront through a selection in the AWS Management Console. |ENDSENT|
|STARTSENT| You can think of a CDN as a distributed caching system. |ENDSENT|
